quest.name: Bringing Down the Mountain
journal: Axemaster Wyrnzoen appears to have some urgent news for you.
Wyrnzoen informs you that Kujata has been spotted in lower La Noscea. Before seeking to do battle with the rampaging beast, the axemaster bids you first visit Sighard at the Red Rooster Stead.

Sighard has once again begged you to slay the beast responsible for the death of his parents. It seems, however, that you will not be alone in the task. Speak with Solkwyb and Broenbhar before leaving the Stead, and enlist their aid for the coming battle.

Solkwyb and Broenbhar are both eager to stand at your side as you seek to bring down the Stampeding Mountain. Follow Broenbhar's advice, and track down Kujata by following the beast's trail of destruction.
You have found the broken remnants of a pot, but Kujata is nowhere to be seen. Continue following the trail left by him and his pack of rapacious scavengers.
You have discovered the shattered pieces of a barrel on the side of the road, but have yet to spot Kujata. Continue following the trail of destruction left behind by the monster and his pack.
You have stumbled upon the splintered remains of a crate, but Kujata himself appears to have since moved on. Continue your search for the vile beast and the ravenous creatures that follow him.

You have finally caught up with Kujata and ended the murderous aurochs' terrible rampage. Wyrnzoen appears with Sighard and Neddard in tow, just in time to help celebrate your hard-won victory. Sighard is overcome with gratitude. Now that you have freed the boy from his burden of vengeance, he has decided to pursue the path of a hero. All that remains is to speak with your waiting colleagues.
Wyrnzoen, Solkwyb, and Broenbhar all applaud the mighty deed you have accomplished. Return to Limsa Lominsa, and speak with the axemaster once more back at the guild.

Wyrnzoen, having imparted to you all the knowledge of axecraft that he possesses, bids you venture beyond the teachings of the guild. And once you have attained a new peak of marauder perfection, he hopes you will return to share your discoveries. The world─with all its wondrous and deadly challenges─is yours to explore.
objectives: Speak to Sighard at the Red Rooster Stead.
Speak with Wyrnzoen at the Marauders' Guild.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Forename. Your confrontation with the beast is at hand─Kujata has made his presence known.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Reports place the creature to the northeast of the Red Rooster Stead, in the vicinity of the Grey Fleet.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: There is little more for me to say but this: harness all the strength you have built through your labors of sweat and blood, and unleash it full-fury upon Kujata and his menagerie of scavengers.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Sighard yet lies abed, trusting in your strength and praying for your victory.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I ask that you go to the lad before the battle, and tell him you venture forth to fell the object of his vengeance. Such news should cheer his ailing heart.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: The time is come, Forename Surname! May your axe strike deep and true!

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Forename... I'm sorry fer makin' trouble.

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: No, I deserved what I got. It's me own fault fer not believin' in ye...

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: B-But ye came back anyway! And now yer gonna take that axe to Kujata's head, ain't ye!?

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: I know ye can beat that bastard! Ye got to!

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Please, Forename! Ye got to make 'im pay!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: I heard Kujata had reared his ugly head again, and reckoned you'd not be too far behind.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: I hope you won't object to me lending what aid I can. We've been through much, you and I, and I would see this tale to its end.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Broenbhar, well, he felt much the same. So here we are─a pack of two to offset the ravenous beasts that follow in Kujata's wake.

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text: Might be as I'm stickin' me nose in where it ain't wanted, but I couldn't abide the thought o' ye facin' that monster solo. Kujata's got his friends, so it's only fair if ye've got a couple, too.

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text: An' what're friends for if not to lighten yer load? I already did some o' the groundwork for ye. Seems like a farmer an' his wain have fallen victim to the fiend's pack.

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text: If we follow the trail o' destruction, it might just lead us to the big bugger himself.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a pot that appears to have been dragged from the farmer's wain.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a barrel that appears to have been dragged from the farmer's wain.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a crate that appears to have been dragged from the farmer's wain.

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Bringing Down the Mountain”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: It appears our timing was fortuitous.

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: The axemaster carried me 'ere so's I could see...

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Ye did it. Ye really did it...

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: <sniffle> Ma? Da? Do ye see? Forename killed the bastard! 'E's finally dead!

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Thank ye. Thank all of ye.

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Forename? Do ye reckon I could learn to swing an axe like that?

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: When I's bigger, I mean. I want to protect folk, too. Keep 'em safe from...ye know, monsters an' things.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: If you train hard, then naught is beyond your reach, young man.

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Then that's what I'll do! I'll train every single day!

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Ye'll see! I'll be the strongest 'ero there ever was!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: It is done, Forename. You have answered the boy's prayers, and upheld the pride of the guild.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Hold your head high, marauder! I shall be awaiting your triumphant return to Limsa Lominsa!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Well done, Forename! I knew from the first moment we met that you would rise to meet any challenge!

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text: I saw it with me own eyes, an' I can still scarce believe it. Ye brought down the Mountain...

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: That was truly a mighty feat, Forename. Never have I seen a marauder so dedicated to attaining the pinnacle of herhis discipline.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: In recognition of your achievements, I, Axemaster Wyrnzoen, pass on to you our guild's final technique: the Thrill of Battle.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: This skill teaches you to embrace the fear and danger of combat, allowing you to push well beyond the normal limits of your stamina.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Though the thought brings me both joy and sadness, there is naught more I can teach you. May the memories of your time here at the guild sustain you as you strive for ever greater heights of perfection.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Experience, now, shall be your tutor. There will always be greater foes and deadlier challenges on which to test your blade─of that, I am certain.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: You enter a realm of our craft in which even I have never set foot. I only hope that when you reach the very boundaries of our art, you will return to share your triumphs with us. Until then, Forename, may your axe ever swing true!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Kujata!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text:
This is it, Forename.
Send the beast to the abyss!

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text:
Focus on fightin' Kujata!
Leave the hyenas to me!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text:
Be on your guard!
He's up to something!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text:
I can barely close your wounds!
What has he done to you!?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text:
Ugh, no wonder his victims
were so hard to heal!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Hold on, Forename!

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text:
More damn hyenas!
Quickly now─put that bastard down!

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text: When did me axe...get so heavy...?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: And thus the tale ends for me...

obj.n: Pride and Duty (Will Take You from the Mountain)
